dt: {bc}the act or the condition of lagging
{bc}an amount of lagging or the time during which lagging continues
{bc}a space of time especially between related events or phenomena {bc}{sx|interval||}
{bc}the action of lagging for opening shot (as in marbles or billiards)
{bc}a usually long putt struck with the aim of having the ball stop near the hole

et: probably of Scandinavian origin; akin to Norwegian dialect {it}lagga{/it} to go slowly
shortdef: one that lags or is last
the act or the condition of lagging

dt: {bc}to move, function, or develop with comparative slowness
{bc}to become retarded in attaining maximum value
{bc}to toss or roll a marble toward a line or a cue ball toward the head cushion to determine order of play
{bc}to pitch or shoot (a coin, a marble, etc.) at a mark
{bc}to hit (a golf ball or putt) with the aim of having the ball stop near the hole

dt.t: Woods {wi}lagged{/wi} his first putt to within four feet and then sank his second one to win.

pt: {sc}delay{/sc} {sc}procrastinate{/sc} {sc}lag{/sc} {sc}loiter{/sc} {sc}dawdle{/sc} {sc}dally{/sc} mean to move or act slowly so as to fall behind. {sc}delay{/sc} usually implies a putting off of something (such as a beginning or departure).
{sc}procrastinate{/sc} implies blameworthy delay especially through laziness or apathy.
{sc}lag{/sc} implies failure to maintain a speed set by others.
{sc}loiter{/sc} and {sc}dawdle{/sc} imply delay while in progress, especially in walking, but {sc}dawdle{/sc} more clearly suggests an aimless wasting of time.

pt.t: children {it}dawdling{/it} on their way home from school

pt: {sc}dally{/sc} suggests delay through trifling or vacillation when promptness is necessary.

shortdef: to stay or fall behind : linger, loiter
to move, function, or develop with comparative slowness
to become retarded in attaining maximum value

dt: {bc}a stave, slat, or strip (as of wood or asbestos) forming part of a covering for a cylindrical object

et: probably of Scandinavian origin; akin to Old Norse {it}lǫgg{/it} rim of a barrel
shortdef: a stave, slat, or strip (as of wood or asbestos) forming part of a covering for a cylindrical object
to cover or provide with lags
to transport or jail for crime

dt: {bc}a condition that is characterized by various psychological and physiological effects (such as fatigue and irritability), occurs following long flight through several time zones, and probably results from disruption of circadian rhythms in the human body

shortdef: a condition that is characterized by various psychological and physiological effects (such as fatigue and irritability), occurs following long flight through several time zones, and probably results from disruption of circadian rhythms in the human body

dt: {bc}an interval of time between two related phenomena (such as a cause and its effect)

shortdef: an interval of time between two related phenomena (such as a cause and its effect)
